item.title: Portainer
item.description: Portainer: Managing Docker Containers Although I’m comfortable with the command line, it is nice to have a GUI to manage the containers. Portainer is an open-source management UI for Docker, including Docker Swarm environment.

item.title: Flask with Connexion
item.description: Connexion is a framework that automagically handles HTTP requests based on OpenAPI Specification (formerly known as Swagger Spec) of your API described in YAML format. Connexion allows you to write an OpenAPI specification, then maps the endpoints to your Python functions; this makes it unique, as many tools generate the specification based on your Python code. You can describe your REST API in as much detail as you want; then Connexion guarantees that it will work as you specified.

item.title: Installing Nginx Server
item.description: Installing Nginx Server How To Install Nginx on Ubuntu 18.04[^1] Introduction Nginx is one of the most popular web servers in the world and is responsible for hosting some of the largest and highest-traffic sites on the internet.

item.title: VS-Code as a Server
item.description: Code on your Chromebook, tablet, and laptop with a consistent dev environment. If you have a Windows or Mac workstation, more easily develop for Linux. Take advantage of large cloud servers to speed up tests, compilations, downloads, and more.

item.title: Pipenv
item.description: Pipenv tool for Python package management Why using pipenv Instead of needing the pip library for package installation, plus a library for creating a virtual environment,plus a library for managing virtual environments, plus all the commands associated with those libraries, one can just just Pipenv.
